description: From Latin melicus, from Koine Greek μελικός (melikós), from Ancient Greek μέλος (mélos, “song, lyric”).

adjectives.description: melic (comparative more melic, superlative most melic)

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to Greek lyric verse. [from 17th c.]
examples: I dined at their house, and in the evening, Miss Hart gave a demonstration of her musical and melic [translating melischen] talents.

description: From translingual Melica (genus name), probably from Italian melica, meliga (“sorghum, millet”).

entries.meaning: Any of various grasses, of the genus Melica, from northern temperate regions. [from 18th c.]
